thread.title: “It's been an absolute honour”: Michelle Keegan marks end of Tina and Bobby
thread.title_full: “It's been an absolute honour”: Michelle Keegan marks end of Tina and Bobby

author: Alistair McGeorge
title: “It's been an absolute honour”: Michelle Keegan marks end of Tina and Bobby
text:
Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Michelle Keegan has marked the end of the hit drama Tina and Bobby with a sweet message to her fans. 
The actress, who has received high praise for her role in the drama, thanked her fans for support after the finale aired. 
“That's a WRAP !! Tina and Bobby,What a story,What a journey,What a series,It's been an absolute honour. Thankyou for all your support,” she tweeted. 
It's been widely praised, but Michelle did have to defend herself after an embarrassing blunder that saw her claim football wasn't a big sport in the 1960s. 
At the time of the gaffe, the star - whose role in Tina & Bobby would suggest she should recall England's World Cup victory in 1966 - was talking about Sir Bobby Moore and his first wife Tina's role as the first celebrity couple . 
Now, Michelle has responded to the blooper, telling Metro: "It was early in the morning and the words just didn't come out the way I wanted. Michelle stars with Lorne MacFadyen in Tina & Bobby (Photo: Stuart Wood) 
"Of course I know football was a big deal in the 1960s - England won the World Cup. What I meant was back then, footballers didn't have the celebrity status they have now. 
"It was a different world for Tina and Bobby - they were football's first golden couple." She previously suggested football wasn't a big deal in the 1960s (Photo: Stuart Wood) She was trolled for the comments (Photo: Stuart Wood/itv) 
Speaking on BBC Breakfast in September, the star claimed football wasn't a "major sport" in the UK. 
She said: "Back in the sixties people didn't really know anything about football. It wasn't really a major sport back then." Ringing any bells, Michelle? (Photo: Daily Mirror) She insisted she mean Tina and Bobby were the first celebrity couple (Photo: Popperfoto/Getty) 
Not surprisingly, Michelle's comments saw her trolled on social media with many viewers poking fun at her for the blunder. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
